bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, November 13, 1905

div1.p: Howard saw many things on his trip to New Orleans that would greatly interest Carroll. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, November 13, 1905
div1.p:
Thank you for yours of the 1st instant, which I
find on my desk after a trip to the Southwest. It was kind of you to
send Dr. Latham the slide. I have just come from New Orleans, and saw
lots of things there which would greatly interest you.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, L. O. Howard Chief of Bureau.
Dr. James Carroll, U. S. A.,
Curator, Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
ha
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
